candidates.name: Korikori Hawkins
candidates.why_elect: I'm proud to be seventh generation Waikato Tainui and I have a natural ability to engage with a broad range of people, both culturally and professionally.
candidates.why_stand: I believe I have the skills and experience to lead Council vision to create thriving, connected and liveable communities and I am passionate about change.

candidates.name: Simon Thomson
candidates.why_elect: I am a fourth generation farmer running 260 hectares of beef and dairy support animals. Additional experience I bring includes engineering in the agriculture, aquaculture, bio-plastics, yachting and drone industries, I have worked for Xtreme Zero Waste in materials ecology and electronics recycling, and with DoC in the Chatham Islands.
candidates.why_stand: I declare a climate emergency, and that farming is the solution to this emergency through analysing our landscapes and supporting the goal of every farm having 20% of their income from non-animal-protein sources within five years, and 50% in 10 years. Make the 'Waikato' a world recognised brand.
